document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Homidia (Collembola, Entomobryidae) and a key to species in the genus from Zhejiang Province, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Homidia (Collembola, Entomobryidae) and a key to species in the genus from Zhejiang Province, China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype .
1 ♀ on slide, China , Zhejiang Province, Wenzhou City, Yueqing, Caijialin village
28 ° 25 '53.10"N
,
121 °0'42.04"E
, elev. 151 ± 3 m , sample number S
4448, 16
.I. 2015 , Z-X Pan, Y-H Pan and C-C Si.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 30–33. Colour pattern of
H. quadrimaculata
sp. nov.
: 30–32. Adult: 30–31. Lateral view; 32. Dorsal view; 33. Dorsal view of juvenile.

FIGURES 34–42.
H. quadrimaculata
sp. nov.
: 34. Cephalic chaetotaxy; 35. Basal part of Ant. I; 36. Smooth chaetae on basal Ant. II; 37. Distal part of Ant. II; 38. Ant. III organ; 39. Apical bulb and tip of Ant. IV; 40. Labial and posterior labial chaetal formula; 41. Labial palp; 42. Maxillary outer lobe. (Figures 34–37, 39 dorsal view; Figures 38, 40–42 ventral view).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes .
2 ♀ on slides and
3 adults
in ethanol, same data as holotype . All types deposited in TZU.
Etymology. Named after four dark spots (Latin: quadrus+macula) on central thorax.

Complete body sens as 22 / 122 (about 39 ) 3 , ms as 10 / 10100 . Th. II with 4 (m 1 , m 2 , m
2 i
and m
2 i
2 ) mediomedial, 3 (m 4 , m
4 i
and m 4 p) medio-sublateral and 3 S-chaetae (ms antero-internal to sens); posterior region with 27–32 mac; p 4 , p
4 i
and p 5 as mac, p 6 as mic. Th. III with 32–36 mac and 2 sens; p 5 and p 6 as mac (
Fig. 43
). Coxal macrochaetal formula as 3 ( 1 pseudopore) / 4 + 1, 3 ( 3 pseudopores) / 4 + 2 ( 2 pseudopores) (
Fig. 44
a–c). Trochanteral organ with 28–32 smooth chaetae (
Fig. 45
). Tenent hair capitate. Unguis with 4 inner, 2 lateral and 1 outer teeth. Unguiculus lanceolate with outer edge slightly serrate, inner tibiotarsus with weakly ciliated chaetae (
Fig. 46
).

Ecology . Found in leaf litter of
Eriobotrya japonica (Thunb.)
and
Myrica rubra (Lour.)
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Detailed comparison between
H. quadrimaculata
sp. nov.
and

.

tr.th: Dark pigment rings on Ant. I
Chaeta m5 on lateral Abd. I
Chaeta a2 on area A4 of Abd. III
Chaeta A4 on area A8 of Abd. IV
Chaeta p0 on medial Abd. V
Teeth on inner edge of unguis

subSubSection.paragraph: Note: *: other distribution records based on our sample: Guangdong Province, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Guizhou Province.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 43–47.
H. quadrimaculata
sp. nov.
: 43. Dorsal chaetotaxy of Th. II–Abd. III; 44. Coxal chaetal formula (a. Fore leg; b. Mid leg; c. Hind leg); 45. Trochanteral organ; 46. Distal tibiotarsus and claw of hind left leg (lateral view); 47. Tenaculum.

FIGURES 48–52.
H. quadrimaculata
sp. nov.
: 48. Dorsal chaetotaxy of Abd. IV–V; 49. Ventral tube (lateral view); 50. Manubrial plaque (dorsal view); 51. Basal part of dens (dorsal view); 52. Distal part of dens and mucro (lateral view).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks .
Homidia qualrimaculata
sp. nov.
is identified by its unique colour pattern, 4 ( 6 ) mac on areas A 8– 10 of Abd. IV, ms anterior to sens on Abd. I, and median sens external to m 3 on Abd. V.

The new species is most similar to
Homidia sichuanensis
Jia et al. 2010
in colour pattern on head and abdomen, dorsal chaetotaxy of head and thorax and subapical smooth chaetae on posterior face of VT. But, it can be separated from the latter by four dark patches centrally on thorax ( 2 on
H. sichuanensis
), chaeta l 1 on labial base smooth (ciliate on
H. sichuanensis
), chaetae m 5 on Abd. I and A 4 on Abd. IV as mic (mac on
H. sichuanensis
). The detailed morphological differences are listed in
Table 2
.
